content.description: The YARD, is Spicy climb at 5.10b. The wall can be climbing in many different ways.YARD—System of tracks for making up trains or storing cars. (Boomer's version: "System of rust surrounded y fence and inhabited by a dumb bunch of natives who will not let a train in or out.") Also called garden and ield. Yard geese are yard switchmen. Y.M. is yardmaster. Yard goat is switching engineEstablished: March 2013, by Rick Krause & Neil Obringer
content.location: Half way between Twin Cracks and Whispering Springs , take climbers train down across the canyon, heading West.

content.description: There are not lowering chains.Established: March 2013, by Rick Krause & Neil ObringerTRAVELING GRUNT—Road foreman of engines, traveling engineer. Sometimes called traveling.
content.location: Half way between Twin Cracks and Whispering Springs , take climbers train down across the canyon, heading West. The most westerly climb.

content.description: There are three top bolts that give two different climbs. 5.8 and a 5.10GOO-GOO EYE—Locomotive with two firedoorsEstablished: March 2013, by Rick Krause & Neil Obringer
content.location: Half way between Twin Cracks and Whispering Springs , take climbers train down across the canyon, heading West.

content.description: This is a Hot climb in the 5.11a rangeEstablished: March 2013, by Rick Krause & Neil Obringer
content.location: Half way between Twin Cracks and Whispering Springs , take climbers train down across the canyon, heading West.

content.description:
This is the best area to climb when it is hot, because it is a North aspect. There are four top rope climbs, and one bolt lead climb. All in the 5.7-5.10+ range. The best climb is called the "Yard" from one set of bolts you can climb the face 5-6 different ways, because of the many horizontal and vertical cracks. 

  Átya tpísh is Sahaptin language for the word north face.
